RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Paolo Tronville received a Master in Mechanical Engineering and a PhD in Energetics from Politecnico di Torino. In June 1997 he joined the 2nd Faculty of Engineering in Vercelli as an Assistant Professor in Environmental Technical Physics and he was confirmed in 2000. From January 2012 he took service as an Associate Professor in the Energy Department of Politecnico di Torino. He has been teaching several courses like: "Fundamentals and applications of Thermodynamics", "Heat transfer, acoustics and lighting", "Thermal systems" and "Energy use in buildings". His scientific activity is concerned mainly with aerosol science and technology and it can be considered both experimental and numerical. Between 1993 and 1998 he updated and developed further the activity of the laboratory "Air filtration and aerosol technology" of Politecnico di Torino which has become during the years one the most renown independent laboratories all over the world. Subsequently he developed some innovative approaches in the numerical modeling of air cleaning equipment. The integration of the knowledge based on experimental activity with some more theoretical intuitions led to the development of innovative methods to characterize and understand the behavior of air filtration devices and media. The activity of Paolo Tronville is well known also abroad where he participates actively in several technical committees and organizations. In fact he is the chairman of ISO TC142 "Cleaning equipment for air and other gases" and CEN TC195 "Air filters for general air cleaning". He is a voting member of several ASHRAE (American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air-conditioning Engineers) technical committees. He is a member of AAAR (American Association for Aerosol Research) and of AFS (American Filtration & Separations Society). In Italy he is the chairman of the Italian Technical Advisory Group of CTI (Italian Thermotechnical Committee) and of CUNA (Technical Committee for the Automobile Standardization) working groups 6 and 9, dealing with engine air intake filtration and cabin air filtration. He is a member of the Scientific Committee of ASCCA (Italian Association for Contamination Control). He has been invited to give presentations and seminars in universities and scientific institutions in Italy and abroad. He is a reviewer for the international journals: ASHRAE Journal, ASHRAE Transactions, Chemical Engineering Technology, CLEAN, HVAC&R Research, Powder Technology, SAE (Society of Automotive Engineers) Transactions. He has been responsible for several research and consultancy activities and is author of more than 90 publications.
